threeday.summary:
In Somerset, severe river flooding on the Somerset Levels will continue for at least the next three days.
River levels are now gradually falling on the River Thames, however, there are still significant flooding impacts. The flood risk here has reduced to MEDIUM.
There is a very low likelihood of significant coastal flooding (LOW flood risk) on Thursday until Saturday, along parts of the north coast of Devon and Cornwall. This also applies around Chiswell and Preston Beach in Dorset, where beach defences have been degraded.
In Worcestershire and Gloucestershire (River Severn), significant flooding will continue until Wednesday or Thursday. In Kent, significant flooding is possible along parts of the River Stour for the next three days and in Herefordshire there is ongoing significant disruption from slow draining floodplains along the River Wye today. Impacts from flooding in these areas may include flooding of communities and disruption to travel. There is also a risk of minor disruption at times in the next three days along other parts of the River Severn and the lower Dee (as coloured yellow in the maps below). Here there may be flooding of individual properties and parts of communities as well as travel difficulties.
There is an ongoing risk from groundwater flooding in Hampshire, Wiltshire, Brighton and Hove, Kent and Greater London (Croydon area) for the next three days. Significant impacts are expected such as flooding to properties and roads, and travel disruption. There is also a risk of minor groundwater flooding in Dorset and much of south-east England through the next three days.
This forecast is updated at least once daily - please check again for the latest forecast. For local flood information please contact Floodline 0345 9881188 or 0845 9881188.
threeday.summary_cymru:
Yng Ngwlad yr Haf, mi fydd y llifogydd afon difrifol ar Wastadeddau Gwlad yr Haf yn parhau am o leiaf y tri diwrnod nesaf.
Mae lefelau afon yn disgyn yn araf ar yr Afon Tafwys, ond mae effeithiau sylweddol llifogydd dal i fod. Mae'r risg o lifogydd yma wedi gostwng i CANOLIG.
Mae yna tebygolrwydd isel iawn o lifogydd arfordirol sylweddol (risg ISEL o lifogydd) ar ddydd Iau tan ddydd Sadwrn ar hyd rhannau o arfordir gogleddol Dyfnaint a Chernyw. Mae hyn hefyd yn berthnasol o amgylch Chiswell a Thraeth Preston yn Dorset, lle mae amddiffynfeydd traeth wedi cael eu diraddio.
Yn Swydd Gaerwrangon a Swydd Gaerloyw (Afon Hafren) bydd llifogydd sylweddol yn parhau tan ddydd Mercher neu dydd Iau. Yng Nghaint, mae llifogydd sylweddol yn bosibl ar hyd rhannau o'r Afon Stour am y tri diwrnod nesaf, ac yn Swydd Henffordd mae aflonyddwch sylweddol yn parhau o ganlyniad i orlifdiroedd sy’n draenio’n araf ar hyd yr Afon Gwy heddiw. Gall effeithiau y lifogydd yn yr ardaloedd yma cynnwys llifogydd i gymunedau ac anhawsterau wrth deithio. Mae yna hefyd risg o ychydig o aflonyddwch ar adegau yn y tri diwrnod nesaf ar hyd rhannau eraill o'r Afon Hafren a’r Afon Dyfrdwy Isaf (fel sydd wedi’i liwio’n felyn ar y mapiau isod). Yma, gall fod llifogydd i dai unigol a rhannau o gymunedau yn ogystal ac anawsterau wrth deithio.
Mae risg parhaus o lifogydd dwr daear yn Hampshire, Wiltshire, Brighton, Hove , Caint a Llundain Fwyaf (ardal Croydon) am y tri diwrnod nesaf. Disgwylir effeithiau sylweddol fel llifogydd i dai a ffyrdd, ac anaswterau wrth deithio. Mae yna hefyd risg o ychydig o lifogydd dwr daear yn Dorset a llawer o dde-ddwyrain Lloegr drwy'r tri diwrnod nesaf.
Mae'r rhagolwg hwn yn cael ei ddiweddaru o leiaf unwaith y dydd - edrychwch eto ar gyfer y rhagolygon diweddaraf.
Ar gyfer gwybodaeth llifogydd lleol, cysylltwch â Floodline ar 0345 9881188 neu 0845 9881188.

risk.impact: Severe disruption. Widespread flooding of property. Severe disruption to travel. Loss of gas, electricity, water supplies. Significant disruption to communities. Evacuation expected.
risk.advice: Significant risk to life. Take action to protect yourself and follow the advice of the emergency services.

risk.impact: Significant disruption. Flooding of homes, businesses and transport links - disruption to travel. Disruption to gas, electricity, water supplies and telecoms. Evacuation may be required.
risk.advice: Flooding of property is expected. Take action to protect yourself and your property.

risk.impact: Minor disruption. Flooding of fields, recreational land and car parks. Flooding of a small number of homes and businesses. Wet road services and possibility of ponding water. Local disruption to travel - longer journey times.
risk.advice: Flooding of property is possible - be prepared. Stay vigilant. Water on roads - take care when driving.

risk.impact: Minimal disruption. Flooding of fields, recreational land and car parks. Some local disruption to travel. Wet road services and possibility of ponding water.
risk.advice: Flooding is possible - be prepared. Stay vigilant. Water on roads - take care when driving.
